Description: One ear-ring and three beads in different shapes. A: One fragment of a penannular ear-ring made of jasper, semi-circular in section. One finished end preserved, the rest broken off. The outer surface is well polished, the inside shows marks from the drill. B: One double-conical bead made of a white stone with tanned inclusions. C: Two fragments of cylindrical segmented beads, the larger one has five segments preserved, made of white faience.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
